items.q: A person’s ethnicity describes his or her _____. a. health b. family situation c. cultural background d. working situation
Trails are similar to _____. a. fields b. roads c. farms d. mountains
If you know the elevation of a place, you know _____. a. how high up it is b. how many people live there c. what the weather is like d. who lives there now
The word stocky describes a person who is _____. a. friendly b. not very thin c. intelligent d. hardworking
People who can live in many different climates are _____. a. adapt b. adapted c. adaptation d. adaptable
George Washington Carver ____ that peanuts could make worn out soil richer. a. discovery b. discover c. discovered d. discoveries
The Sherpas can carry loads of up to _____ pounds. a. 8 b. 10 c. 18 d. 80
The Sherpas originally came from _____. a. Tibet b. Nepal c. Mount Everest d. Himalaya
Which of the following do the Sherpas not add to their tea? a. butter b. spice c. salt d. sugar
The dominant impression is usually ____. a. the topic sentence b. the last sentence c. the second sentence d. a supporting detail
Use descriptive ____ to create a dominant impression. a. nouns b. adverbs c. subjects d. adjectives

George Washington Carver was called "the peanut man" because ____. a. he began a big peanut company. b. he found many ways to use peanuts. c. he dressed as a peanut in town parades. d. he loved to eat peanuts.
Highland University refused to ____ George Washington Carver because he was black. a. hire b. orphan c. admit d. wear out
George Washington Carver received many generous ____ to get high paying jobs. a. offers b. struggles c. inventions d. fields
Which time order word means after a long period of time? a. meanwhile b. eventually c. soon d. while

Which sentence does not have the correct punctuation? a. First, Carver tried to go to Highland College. b. After that, he, continued to work and save money. c. Later, he went to Iowa Agricultural College d. Finally, he was accepted at Tuskegee Institute.
In "Frederick Douglass: From a Slave to Freedom," the sentence that gives the dominant impression is ____. a. the last sentence b. the first sentence c. the second sentence d. the fifth sentence
Which words in the paragraph are descriptive adjectives? a. famous and important b. spoke and escaped c. slave and freedom d. help and work
The Sherpas welcome guests _____. a. hospitality b. hospital c. hospitable d. hospitably
The Sherpas are very healthy, _____ they live in such a cold place. a. considering b. consider c. considered d. considerable
The phrase personal effects refers to a person’s _____. a. personality b. personal opinions c. property d. relatives
Livestock are _____. a. heavy rocks b. animals c. plants d. mountain guides
A person who studies agriculture in college, learns about _____. a. plants b. history c. animals d. medicine
If you struggle learning new vocabulary words, you _____. a. like doing it b. avoid doing it c. enjoy doing it d. have a difficult time doing it
To grow peanuts you need _____. a. glue b. poison c. soil d. cotton
When you say you are willing to do something for a friend, you are making _____. a. support b. an offer c. a field d. an orphan
Farmers could grow cotton because their land was _____. a. outstanding b. worn out c. admitted d. discovered
In the 1800s, college didn’t provide _____ for black Americans. a. opportunities b. agriculture c. fields d. factories
When you allow people to enter your home, you _____ them. a. support them b. praise them c. admit them d. wear them out
Carver was _____ to Simpson College in 1890. a. admit b. admitted c. admittance d. admitting
Farmers are always trying out new _____ methods. a. agricultural b. agriculturally c. agriculture’s d. agriculture
A flashlight stops working when the batteries _____. a. wears out b. wearing out c. worn out d. wear out
George Washington Carver made many advances in the field of music.
The Sherpas can sleep outdoors in temperatures below freezing.
Mount Everest is the eighth tallest mountain in the world.
A dominant impression is the effect a person has on our feelings.
The Tuskegee Institute was a college that whites and blacks attended.
One of Carver's main goals was to help struggling Southern farmers.
Carver believed that education and freedom were closely connected.
Many Sherpas work as mountain guides for foreign climbers.
In a narrative essay, the conclusion tells the end of the story or the results of the event.
The word aptitude means ability.
The summit is the bottom of the mountain.
Narratives contain descriptions of people and places.
Eventually is an example of a time order word.
Carver became rich.
Carver left home at the age of 12.
Write the sentence from the paragraph that gives the dominant impression of Frederick Douglass?
Write two sentences from the paragraph "Frederick Douglass: From a Slave to Freedom" that support the dominant impression. A. B.
Write a paragraph about someone that you know and you admire. Use descriptive adjectives to describe him or her.
